fields.headline: Priors Lodge strikes back
fields.bodyText: Marcus Tregoning's "horrible week" took a dramatic turn for the better at Goodwood on Saturday when Priors Lodge landed the Celebration Mile by a head from Passing Glance. "Priors Lodge was really fresh when he first came to me back in the spring," said Tregoning. "He took a lunge towards his lead horse and unfortunately that horse belted him one and fractured his jaw. "He had to take a lot of time off, but he's come back well and has been moving well all year otherwise. I would certainly think he will stay in training next year. "It is great that a tactical race worked out in our favour for a change as it has been a horrible week," Tregoning added, referring to the disappointing efforts of Nayef and High Accolade at York. "Nayef came back with a deep cut and he will need a couple of weeks off. I think it happened in the stalls."
